meanings.definition: Aghas (noun): A title for a Turkish military officer or official.
meanings.sent1: The aghas in the Turkish army are respected leaders.
meanings.sent2: The aghas gathered for a meeting to discuss military strategies.
meanings.sent3: The aghas decided to have a friendly competition to boost morale.
meanings.sent4: The aghas guided their troops with wisdom and courage.
meanings.sent5: The aghas wore distinguished uniforms to show their rank.

meanings.definition: Aghas (verb): To act as a leader or commander.
meanings.sent1: He aghas the team with confidence and determination.
meanings.sent2: She aghas the group during times of crisis.
meanings.sent3: The cat aghas the other pets in the house, always leading the way.
meanings.sent4: The sun aghas the sky, shining brightly for all to see.
meanings.sent5: The teacher aghas the classroom with enthusiasm and knowledge.
